instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes not detecting magsafe
threads.message:
Hi, 

Got this board, no  liquid damage. The problem is that sometimes it is not detecting magsafe ( no light on it). Already checked ISL65... and 17/18, 27/28 are ok. Reballed SMC and still have that issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes not detecting magsafe
threads.message:
Did you try another DCIN board and charger?
Clean their contacts first.
Inspect <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/1 for corrosion.
Check continuity from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> to Magsafe central pin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes not detecting magsafe
threads.message: dcin is new, already changed it,  will change U700 tomorrow

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes not detecting magsafe
threads.message:
Any reason to change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?
You don't check voltages/signals before changing something?
